alert.note: Alert for South Laramie Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: High Wind Watch issued December 24 at 2:49PM MST until December 27 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE TUESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...West to northwest winds 35 to 45 MPH with gusts up to 60 MPH possible. Ground blizzard conditions are also possible due to significant blowing and drifting snow. * WHERE...South Laramie Range along Interstate 80 between Laramie and Cheyenne. * WHEN...5 PM MST Monday until 5 AM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Mainly to transportation. Strong cross winds will be hazardous to light weight or high profile vehicles, including campers and tractor trailers. Ground blizzard conditions will also be possible due to the combination of strong winds and fresh snow cover. Visibilities may be significantly reduced.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Fasten loose objects or shelter objects in a safe location prior to the onset of winds.
